summary: IN JUNE 1999, I PURCHASED A 1999 MAZDA 626.  I HAVE 27,743 MILES ON IT.  (I RIDE MOSTLY IN MY HUSBAND'S SUV).  TWO DAYS AGO, THE TRANSMISSION BEGAN TO SLIP.  THE DEALER TELLS ME THE 36 MONTH WARRANTY HAS EXPIRED.  I SAY WARRANTY OR NOT AT 27,000 MILES THE TRANSMISSION SHOULD NOT BE SLIPPING--UNLESS THERE WAS A PROBLEM WITH IT WHEN IT WAS INSTALLED.  I REFUSE TO PAY $2000+ FOR A NEW TRANSMISSION AND AM SEEKING ARBITRATION AGAINST THE DEALER.  I AM ASTONISHED TO SEE ALL OF THE OTHER COMPLAINTS ABOUT THE 626 TRANSMSSION I READ ON "THE COMPLAINT STATION" WEBSITE.  FROM WHAT I READ ON THIS SITE, THE PROBLEM IS THE FORD TRANSMISSION.  SOMETHING MUST BE DONE CONCERING THIS PROBLEM.  A RECALL IS IN ORDER.  THANK YOU.
